001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003import squidpony.annotation.Beta;
004
005/**
006 * An interface for point hashes that are statistically biased, as well as a holder for inner classes that implement
007 * this. The point hashes here are mostly chosen because they are aesthetically interesting, at least on some of their
008 * output bits.
009 * <br>
010 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 4/14/2020.
011 */
012@Beta
013public interface FlawedPointHash extends IPointHash, IFlawed {
014    /**
015     * Produces hashes that show strong bias on one axis (usually the later axes matter more) and have nice-looking
016     * patterns of dots. Better patterns are present in the higher bits.
017     */
018    class RugHash extends IPointHash.LongImpl implements FlawedPointHash {
019        public RugHash() {
020        }
021
022        public RugHash(long state) {
023            super(state);
024        }
025
026        public long getState() {
027            return state;
028        }
029
030        public static int hashLongs(long x, long y, long s) {
031            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + y);
032            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
033            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (y + x);
034            return (int) (s >>> 32);
035        }
036
037        public static int hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long s) {
038            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + z);
039            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
040            z = (z + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ z) * (y + x);
041            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (z + y);
042            return (int) (s >>> 32);
043        }
044
045        public static int hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long s) {
046            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + w);
047            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
048            z = (z + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ z) * (y + x);
049            w = (w + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ w) * (z + y);
050            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (w + z);
051            return (int) (s >>> 32);
052        }
053
054        public static int hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long u, long v, long s) {
055            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + v);
056            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
057            z = (z + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ z) * (y + x);
058            w = (w + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ w) * (z + y);
059            u = (u + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ u) * (w + z);
060            v = (v + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ v) * (u + w);
061            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (v + u);
062            return (int) (s >>> 32);
063        }
064
065        @Override
066        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int state) {
067            return hashLongs(x, y, state);
068        }
069
070        @Override
071        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int state) {
072            return hashLongs(x, y, z, state);
073        }
074
075        @Override
076        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int state) {
077            return hashLongs(x, y, z, w, state);
078        }
079
080        @Override
081        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v, int state) {
082            return hashLongs(x, y, z, w, u, v, state);
083        }
084    }
085
086    /**
087     * Extremely flawed if you're using this as a point hash, but meant to be aesthetically interesting, this produces
088     * different symmetrical patterns in squares, as if on a quilt.
089     */
090    class QuiltHash extends IPointHash.LongImpl implements FlawedPointHash {
091        private int size = 6;
092        private long mask = (1L << size) - 1L;
093        public QuiltHash() {
094        }
095
096        public QuiltHash(long state) {
097            super(state);
098        }
099
100        public QuiltHash(long state, int size) {
101            super(state);
102            setSize(size);
103        }
104
105        public long getState() {
106            return state;
107        }
108
109        public int getSize() {
110            return size;
111        }
112
113        public void setSize(int size) {
114            this.size = 32 - Integer.numberOfLeadingZeros(Math.max(1, size));
115            mask = (1L << this.size) - 1L;
116        }
117
118        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long s) {
119            s ^= (x >> size) * 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL;
120            s ^= (y >> size) * 0x91E10DA5C79E7B1DL;
121            x *= x;
122            y *= y;
123            x = x >>> 1 & mask;
124            y = y >>> 1 & mask;
125            long t;
126            if (x < y) {
127                t = x;
128                x = y;
129                y = t;
130            }
131            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + y);
132            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
133            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (y + x);
134            return s;
135        }
136
137        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long s) {
138            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, z, s), s);
139//            s ^= (x >> size) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L;
140//            s ^= (y >> size) * 0xABC98388FB8FAC03L;
141//            s ^= (z >> size) * 0x8CB92BA72F3D8DD7L;
142//            x *= x;
143//            y *= y;
144//            z *= z;
145//            x &= mask;
146//            y &= mask;
147//            z &= mask;
148//            long t;
149//            if (x < y && z < y) {
150//                t = x;
151//                x = y;
152//                y = t;
153//            }
154//            else if(x < y && y < z){
155//                t = x;
156//                x = z;
157//                z = t;
158//            }
159//            else if(y < x && x < z){
160//                t = y;
161//                y = z;
162//                z = t;
163//            }
164//            else if(y < x && z < x){
165//                t = y;
166//                y = z;
167//                z = t;
168//            }
169//
170//            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + z);
171//            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
172//            z = (z + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ z) * (y + x);
173//            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (z + y);
174//            return (int) (s >>> 32);
175        }
176
177        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long s) {
178            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, hashLongs(z, w, s), s), s);
179        }
180
181        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long u, long v, long s) {
182            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, hashLongs(z, hashLongs(w, hashLongs(u, v, s), s), s), s), s);
183        }
184
185        @Override
186        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int state) {
187            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, state) >>> 32);
188        }
189
190        @Override
191        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int state) {
192            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, state) >>> 32);
193        }
194
195        @Override
196        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int state) {
197            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, w, state) >>> 32);
198        }
199
200        @Override
201        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v, int state) {
202            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, w, u, v, state) >>> 32);
203        }
204    }
205
206    /**
207     * Very similar to {@link QuiltHash}, but this doesn't change the pattern in different large squares, and instead
208     * repeats a square or cube of symmetric and patterned results over and over (so it can be tiled).
209     */
210    class CubeHash extends IPointHash.LongImpl implements FlawedPointHash {
211        private int size = 6;
212        private long mask = (1L << size) - 1L;
213        public CubeHash() {
214        }
215
216        public CubeHash(long state) {
217            super(state);
218        }
219
220        public CubeHash(long state, int size) {
221            super(state);
222            setSize(size);
223        }
224
225        public long getState() {
226            return state;
227        }
228
229        public int getSize() {
230            return size;
231        }
232
233        public void setSize(int size) {
234            this.size = 32 - Integer.numberOfLeadingZeros(Math.max(1, size));
235            mask = (1L << this.size) - 1L;
236        }
237
238        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long s) {
239            x &= mask >>> 1;
240            y &= mask >>> 1;
241            x *= x * 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL;
242            y *= y * 0x91E10DA5C79E7B1DL;
243            x = x >>> 1 & mask;
244            y = y >>> 1 & mask;
245            long t;
246            if (x < y) {
247                t = x;
248                x = y;
249                y = t;
250            }
251            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + y);
252            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
253            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (y + x);
254            return s;
255        }
256
257        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long s) {
258            x &= mask >>> 1;
259            y &= mask >>> 1;
260            z &= mask >>> 1;
261//            s ^= (x) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L;
262//            s ^= (y) * 0xABC98388FB8FAC03L;
263//            s ^= (z) * 0x8CB92BA72F3D8DD7L;
264            x *= x * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L;
265            y *= y * 0xABC98388FB8FAC03L;
266            z *= z * 0x8CB92BA72F3D8DD7L;
267            x = x & mask >>> 1;
268            y = y & mask >>> 1;
269            z = z & mask >>> 1;
270            long t;
271            if (x < y) {
272                t = x;
273                x = y;
274                y = t;
275            }
276            if(x < z){
277                t = x;
278                x = z;
279                z = t;
280            }
281            if(y < z){
282                t = y;
283                y = z;
284                z = t;
285            }
286            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + z);
287            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
288            z = (z + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ z) * (y + x);
289            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (z + y);
290            return s;
291        }
292
293        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long s) {
294            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, hashLongs(z, w, s), s), s);
295        }
296
297        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long u, long v, long s) {
298            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, hashLongs(z, hashLongs(w, hashLongs(u, v, s), s), s), s), s);
299        }
300
301        @Override
302        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int state) {
303            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, state) >>> 32);
304        }
305
306        @Override
307        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int state) {
308            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, state) >>> 32);
309        }
310
311        @Override
312        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int state) {
313            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, w, state) >>> 32);
314        }
315
316        @Override
317        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v, int state) {
318            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, w, u, v, state) >>> 32);
319        }
320    }
321
322    /**
323     * FNV32a is OK as a hash for bytes when used in some hash tables, but it has major issues on its low-order bits
324     * when used as a point hash (the high bits aren't much better). Unfortunately, it is not aesthetically pleasing as
325     * a point hash. Some usages might be able to use it to apply a grimy, glitchy effect.
326     */
327    class FNVHash extends IntImpl implements FlawedPointHash {
328
329        public FNVHash() {
330            super();
331        }
332
333        public FNVHash(int state) {
334            super(state);
335        }
336
337        public int getState() {
338            return state;
339        }
340        @Override
341        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int state) {
342            return ((state ^ 0x811c9dc5 ^ x) * 0x1000193 ^ y) * 0x1000193;
343        }
344
345        @Override
346        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int state) {
347            return (((state ^ 0x811c9dc5 ^ x) * 0x1000193 ^ y) * 0x1000193 ^ z) * 0x1000193;
348        }
349
350        @Override
351        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int state) {
352            return ((((state ^ 0x811c9dc5 ^ x) * 0x1000193 ^ y) * 0x1000193 ^ z) * 0x1000193 ^ w) * 0x1000193;
353        }
354
355        @Override
356        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v, int state) {
357            return ((((((state ^ 0x811c9dc5 ^ x) * 0x1000193 ^ y) * 0x1000193 ^ z) * 0x1000193
358                    ^ w) * 0x1000193 ^ u) * 0x1000193 ^ v) * 0x1000193;
359        }
360    }
361}
